metadata.title: CVE-2016-0714 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The session-persistence implementation in Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.45,7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.31, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2 mishandlessession attributes, which allows remote authenticated users to bypassintended SecurityManager restrictions and execute arbitrary code in aprivileged context via a web application that places a crafted object in asession.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0714` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1
No subscription required

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1').
tomcat6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1').
tomcat8 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1').
